result.execSummary:
The defendant Megan A Caruso was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision.  If extended supervision is revoked or will discharge with financial obligations owing, a judgment shall be entered.

miscConds.notes: Bond amount posted shall be applied.  If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol or controlled substance without a valid prescription and then taken as prescribed.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent and comply with recommendations.  

Defendant shall pay any supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Megan A Caruso

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Benjamin T Van Severen.  Atty Mark D. Bensen for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Case recalled at 2:14 p.m.  Defendant has two cases in Kenosha Co.-13CF714 and 14CF227 and Racine Co.-14CF952.  State indicates upon plea to Ct. 1, Ct. 2 would be dismissed for read-in.  Recommend on Ct. 1 is 18 mo. confinement and 2 years of E.S.-stayed for 3 years probation; Costs of $268.00; DNA surcharge of $250.00; DNA sample; Extradition fees of $2,157.00; Counseling per the agent and No controlled substance without a valid prescription.   Guilty plea entered to Ct. 1,  Court dismissed Ct. 2 for read-in.  Court finds def guilty on Ct. 1 and enters judgment.  Defendant makes statements.  Court vacates the judgment and reinstates cash bond and applied to costs/fees.
